Woodlawn Senior Living
Description:
Affordable, Social Services, built to passive house standards.¬†Ground floor preschool facility with outdoor play area.
Now Leasing Affordable Senior Apartments in the Bronx
We are currently accepting applications for brand-new affordable apartments through the Project-Based Voucher (PBV) Section 8 Program. This community has been designed with comfort, accessibility, and long-term affordability in mind.
Program & Eligibility
These apartments are reserved for individuals or households where at least one member is age 62 or older at the time of application. Eligibility is determined by both age and household size, as well as income limits.
Applicants must qualify for Section 8 housing assistance.
Rent is calculated at 30% of household income, as determined by Section 8 guidelines, and includes utilities.
Maximum annual household income to apply: $56,700.
This building is part of the Senior Affordable Rental Apartments (SARA) Program and supported through the HOME Investment Partnerships Program (HOME) of the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development.
What You‚Äôll Need to Apply
While requirements may vary from household to household, applicants should be prepared to provide:
Proof of income for all household members
Valid identification for each resident
Documentation verifying household size and eligibility
No application fees or deposits are required
Applicants selected will also undergo program verification to confirm Section 8 eligibility.
Advantages & Amenities
This thoughtfully designed building provides a safe, welcoming, and convenient environment for seniors. Amenities include:
‚Äì Shared laundry room with card-operated machines
‚Äì Dedicated storage space for residents
‚Äì Elevator access throughout the building
‚Äì Accessible entrances for ease of mobility
‚Äì Smoke-free living environment
‚Äì Convenient access to public transportation (bus stop nearby)
‚Äì Outdoor common areas to relax and enjoy fresh air
-Free parking is available through a lottery system, with electric vehicle charging offered at applicable rates.
How to Apply
Applying is simple and can be done in one of two ways:
Click Here to Print Application
‚Äì Email completed applications to
applications@riseboro.org
‚Äì Paper applications may be hand delivered to: 217 Wyckoff Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11237
View Fullscreen
For questions about eligibility, applications, or the leasing process, please contact:
Leasing Contact:
Anaisa V. Villanueva

applications@riseboro.org

718-366-3800

The Re-rental Program
When a tenant in a rent-stabilized unit in a TFC building moves, that unit remains rent-stabilized and becomes available for re-rental.
Prospective new tenants who meet the income requirements can apply to join the wait list.
Qualified applicants will have the opportunity to lease rent stabilized apartments that are in the re-rental pool. The lottery is run in cooperation with TF Cornerstone, the NYC Housing Development Corporation (HDC), and the NYC Department of Housing Preservation and Development (HPD).
Actual rent may vary based on lease terms. A 3% increase for one-year leases commencing on or after October 1, 2025, and on or before September 30, 2026, and 4.5% increase for a two-year lease commencing on or after October 1, 2025, and on or before September 30, 2026.

FAQ
General Questions
What is affordable housing and how does it work?
Through Housing Connect, you can find and apply for affordable rental and homeownership opportunities. To qualify, your household must meet the income and size requirements for a unit in the affordable development. Your household is all of the people who will live in the affordable unit.
Housing is considered affordable if it costs about one-third or less of what the people living there get in income.
The New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development (HPD) and Housing Development Corporation (HDC) create affordable housing opportunities for many household income levels and sizes. The buildings are privately owned. HPD and HDC have a monitoring and oversight role.
Application Questions
I can‚Äôt find my verification code.
Housing Connect uses two-step verification for creating your account. Your Housing Connect verification code is sent to a different email (or phone number) than your confirmation email. Check the email address or phone number that you entered as your additional contact info when you signed up. If you‚Äôre still having trouble, check out the Housing Connect training video titled ‚ÄòAccount Setup‚Äô.
Where do I apply for new buildings availabilities instead of re-rentals?
Online:
Apply online through Housing Connect when the lottery opens. For detailed instructions, review the Housing Connect Guidebook.
By mail:
Paper applications can be requested. The address to request a paper application will be updated once the lottery has officially launched.
Where do I enter my information?
After you have created your account, you can view, add, and edit your information from the ‚ÄúMy Household‚Äù page. After logging in, you‚Äôll see your name with an arrow next to it in the top right-hand corner of the page. Click your name, and a dropdown menu will appear. Click the ‚ÄúMy Household‚Äù option. This page shows your Household Summary, Household Members, and Housing Choices. Click the light grey ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù buttons on the right of each section to add your information. For detailed instructions, see How to Apply.
The website is not working and I can‚Äôt apply.
If you‚Äôre still having trouble after reviewing the Applying Online instructions and Housing Connect Training videos, you may want to apply by mail.
What happens after you apply?
It can take several months or longer to hear about your application. Sometimes you might not hear back even if you qualify.
While you‚Äôre waiting, carefully check what your current lease says about moving out before the lease is over. If you‚Äôre offered an apartment, you might need to move quickly.
What are my next steps after I apply?
If your application is selected, you‚Äôll be invited to respond to a document request. This interview is very important. Agents from the building will confirm if you qualify for the opportunity you applied for. Get ready ahead of time to make sure you‚Äôre prepared.
What if I never hear back?
If you aren‚Äôt selected or don‚Äôt hear back, keep searching for other apartments and apply when you are ready.

Langsam Property Services Corp. is a Bronx-based real estate management company. The company is responsible for managing the day-to-day operation of approximately 350 buildings containing over 11,000 dwelling units and 300 commercial units. These buildings are located in the Bronx, Manhattan, Queens, Brooklyn, and lower Westchester County.
When Mark Engel joined the organization in the mid 1970s, it managed 2,500 housing units. Langsam is designated as an Accredited Management Organization (AMO), a standard of excellence in management conferred by the Chicago-based, Institute of Real Estate Management (IREM). Langsam is one of only two AMO's in all of New York State which has four Certified Property Managers directing its property management teams.
All of Langsam's managing agents are either Licensed Associate Real Estate Brokers or Sales Associates. Several are experienced in construction and design. Other professional staff have almost fifty years combined property management and support experience. Its Director of Operations holds a CPM designation and other staff hold advanced degrees in public finance and urban planning. Staff also have held high level positions in New York City government
Langsam Property Services does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex, disability, familial status (minor children under the age of 18), age, sexual orientation, marital status, military status, lawful source of income (including housing voucher programs), gender identity or expression, arrest records, veteran status, and domestic violence victim status.
